channel.title: Comments on: Minor warning for upgrading to 9.0.1

item.title: By: Sean Cull
item.dc:creator: Sean Cull
item.description:
<p>See comment #11 on Stephan's blog here - http://www.wissel.net/blog/d6plinks/SHWL-97WPR9?Open&utm<em>source=feedburner&utm</em>medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+Wisselnet+%28wissel.net%29</p>
<p>The java.pol flle should not get overwritten if i am understanding it orrectly.</p>
item.content:encoded:
See comment #11 on Stephan’s blog here – http://www.wissel.net/blog/d6plinks/SHWL-97WPR9?Open&utmsource=feedburner&utmmedium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+Wisselnet+%28wissel.net%29

The java.pol flle should not get overwritten if i am understanding it orrectly.

item.title: By: Lars Berntrop-Bos
item.dc:creator: Lars Berntrop-Bos
item.description: <p>Re: jvm.properties: <br />If operating in a locked down environment, <datadir>/workspace/.config/rcpinstall.properties overrides jvm.properties and is modifiable by a user...</p>
item.content:encoded:
Re: jvm.properties:
If operating in a locked down environment, <datadir>/workspace/.config/rcpinstall.properties overrides jvm.properties and is modifiable by a user…

item.title: By: Peter von StÃ¶ckel
item.dc:creator: Peter von StÃ¶ckel
item.description: <p>This is basically true for any files that Domino has default versions of. When upgrading it usually doesn't care if a file has been modified since install or not. There was an example from R5 that was commented on notes.net way back, where the newly introduced favicon.ico just replaced custom favicon.ico files that people had placed there. As far as I know, there's no difference today.</p>
item.content:encoded: This is basically true for any files that Domino has default versions of. When upgrading it usually doesn’t care if a file has been modified since install or not. There was an example from R5 that was commented on notes.net way back, where the newly introduced favicon.ico just replaced custom favicon.ico files that people had placed there. As far as I know, there’s no difference today.

item.title: By: Martin Jinoch
item.dc:creator: Martin Jinoch
item.description: <p>The same kind of problem is with Designer, if you have altered <Notes-dir>\framework\rcp\deploy\jvm.properties prior to upgrade, do it again :-)</p>
item.content:encoded: The same kind of problem is with Designer, if you have altered <Notes-dir>\framework\rcp\deploy\jvm.properties prior to upgrade, do it again ðŸ™‚
